text: Lactarius resimus is a species of mushrooms in the genus Lactarius, which is considered a delicacy in Russia and some other countries of Eastern Europe when pickled in salt. There it is considered one of three tastiest edible mushrooms, along with Boletus edulis and Lactarius deliciosus,Васильков Б. П. Съедобные и ядовитые грибы средней полосы Европейской части СССР. Определитель. Moscow - Leningrad: Издательство АН СССР, 1948. though it is not held in high esteem elsewhere. The mushroom forms a mycorrhizal relationship with birch and with conifers too (pine). ==See also== *List of Lactarius species ==References== Category:Fungi described in 1821 resimus Category:Russian cuisine Category:Edible fungi Category:Fungi of Europe Category:Taxa named by Elias Magnus Fries
title: Lactarius resimus
